metadata.dcterms:title: A Randomized Controlled Trial of Children Undergoing Intravenous Placement in the Pediatric Emergency Department: Distraction to Reduce Pain and Distress

metadata.dcterms:description: This study will test if iPads are useful to help lower pain and distress for children who are visiting an emergency department and need an intravenous line put in. The results from this study could be important for many children receiving medical care, as distraction is safe and the use of iPads is enjoyable for many children.

metadata.dcterms:rights: Video recording equipment will capture the patient's facial expressions and body movements, in order to apply an ob servational distress tool (OSBD), so as to measure the distress experienced by the child. No video recordings will be used in the creation of written, published materials, and only the Research Assistants, the research coordinator and the PI responsible for coding the videos using the OSBD tool will watch the videos. They will not be shared with anyone else, including the rest of the research team.
